reviews.review: glados and wheat droid thing are pretty pog ngl

It's so freaking fun
The unique game play and its story telling is insane

TLDR: An essential PC game, everyone with a PC that considers themselves a PC gamer should play this at least once in their life.

Portal is a game like no other, not only in mechanics but in the way it can build the world without directly telling the player anything. The story is gripping, the puzzle aspects are challenging but rewarding, and the second game adds some refreshing new aspects like different liquids that can be portalled around. And don't even get me started on the co-op.

The co-op is in my opinion the best part of this game. And while the singleplayer is great, the co-op takes it to a whole other level. I probably have spent 75% of my hours in this game just messing around with friends, sabotaging them while also having a fun time putting our 2 brain cells together to try and solve the levels. I wish the co-op was longer, but this game is well worth the money for the co-op alone.

Muy bueno, al inicio parece mas de lo mismo con respecto a portal 1 pero luego se va tornando mucho mas interesante y los escenarios cambian drasticamente, tambien hay muchos nuevos elementos para resolver los niveles de formas muy creativas y por fin nos revelan los inicios de aperture science y su creador. Puntuacion: 9/10
Nice brain teaser with a lot's of humor.
Even after almost a decade this is still by far one of the most clever puzzle games.

First game I ever played. Still holds up to this day. Thank you to the team over at Valve, for beginning my journey towards who I am today.

Good puzzles, good story, good characters, good game.

I have recently been trying to get into Valve's whole series of games. So I started with "Portal", which went from me not liking it too much to absolutely loving it. After playing "Portal" I waited a while until I finally played "Portal 2". And I should have played Portal 2 earlier. It was an amazing game. Of course, a lot of the puzzles in the game hurt my brain... A lot. But that is what is so intriguing about this game. It has some of the most well thought out, and advanced level-building skills of any game out there. The characters are so well written out. They actually feel like characters I want to follow along with. Not just objects there to guide me through a game. The story is so good too. Is it impressive? No. It was expected when I started it. I had heard so many good things about this game even before I played it. And it lived up to the hype. This game is a masterpiece in itself. It has whitty humor, and amazing environmental story-telling. 10/10, masterpiece.
